| Learner story - Advanced Product Designer Gi

Marci
Configuration &
Developer

In fact, Advanced Product Designer (APD) is more than
just a product modeling tool. Using APD, you can define
a new product and auto-generate product artifacts,
including all needed entities and Page Configuration
Format (PCF) files to support policy transactions.

What is Advanced Product Designer (APD)? Gi

The APD is a business tool that helps insurers:
¢ Design insurance product based on business requirements using Xmind
* Supports subclause relationships
¢ Simulate policy transactions for that insurance product in PolicyCenter
¢ Auto-generate the product artifacts for PolicyCenter such as:
* Entity Model
« Product Model
« User Interface components (PCFs)
¢ Quickly build and launch product to adapt quickly to market needs

¢ Facilitate business-level product discussions with stakeholders

Advanced Product Designer versus Product Designer Gi

« Add New Products ¢ Add Offerings

« Add New Policy Lines « Add Question Sets

+ Add New Clauses: coverages, ¢ Add Modifiers
coverage terms, coverage term ¢ Add code to perform an action when
options, conditions, and exclusions a clause is added or removed

¢ Enhance availability
« Enhance existence

¢ Enhance default values

Question

_~ — Explain the purpose of the product model in terms of products, policies
x and coverages.

SoS oD DD DDS De Say

Gi

Answer Gi

_~ — Explain the purpose of the product model in terms of products, policies
x and coverages.

The product model is the model that describes how products and policies, including
coverages and coverage terms, are configured in your version of PolicyCenter. The
business needs of your organization drive the product model.

Sop DD DD SDSS oe

Question

,~ — Astakeholder insists that the underwriting rules be configured in the
x product model. Does this request make sense, based on what you have
learned in this lesson? Why or why not?

SoS oD DD DDS De Say

Gi

Answer Gi

,~ — Astakeholder insists that the underwriting rules be configured in the
x product model. Does this request make sense, based on what you have
: learned in this lesson? Why or why not?

This request does not make sense because the underwriting rules are not configured
within the product model. Underwriting rules are configured outside of the product
model.
